== Title ==

Levelset segmentation

== Description ==

Levelset-type segmentation of foreground/background using minimum regional variance energy

== Syntax ==

: <tt>[options] InputImage OutputImage </tt>

where

; <tt>InputImage</tt> : Input image path

; <tt>OutputImage</tt> : Output image path

== List of Supported Options ==

; <tt>--verbose</tt> / <tt>-v</tt> : Verbose mode

; <tt>--binarize</tt> / <tt>-b</tt> : Binarize levelset and write as byte mask, rather than write floating-point levelset function itself.

=== These parameters of control the evolution of the levelset function ===

; <tt>--iterations</tt> <tt><integer></tt> / <tt>-n</tt> <tt><integer></tt> : Maximum number of iterations '''[Default value: 100]'''

; <tt>--force-iterations</tt> / <tt>-f</tt> : Force given number of iterations, even when convergence has been detected

; <tt>--filter-sigma</tt> <tt><double></tt> / <tt>-s</tt> <tt><double></tt> : Gaussian filter sigma in world coordinate units (e.g., mm) '''[Default value: 2]'''

; <tt>--delta</tt> <tt><double></tt> / <tt>-d</tt> <tt><double></tt> : Time constant for levelset evolution; must be > 0; larger is faster '''[Default value: 0.1]'''

; <tt>--levelset-threshold</tt> <tt><double></tt> / <tt>-t</tt> <tt><double></tt> : Levelset threshold: levelset function is truncated at +/- this value '''[Default value: 1]'''

=== Image/Transformation Database ===

; <tt>--db</tt> <tt><string></tt> : Path to image/transformation database that should be updated with the newly created image. '''[Default value: NONE]'''
